heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.6°C) and outside temperature (down 6.0°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 5.0°C), dew point temperature (up 4.5°C), outside temperature (up 5.1°C), and cloud levels (up 183 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 114.0m higher than yesterday, 19.7m higher than the past week, 183.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 835m to 1961m and averaged 1430.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

dew point temperature.description:
Today’s average dew point temperature is 5.7°C lower than yesterday, 4.5°C lower than the past week, 3.1°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s dew point temperatures showed a low of 8.2°C and a peak of 14.9°C, averaging 6.2°C; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
dew point temperature.summary: The atmosphere will feel parched and dry.

feels like temperature.description:
Today’s average feels like temperature is 6.6°C lower than yesterday, 5.0°C lower than the past week, 3.9°C lower than the past month.

The feels like temperatures for yesterday ranged from 8.2°C to 19.2°C and averaged 6.4°C, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
